course_title: Leadership in Global Health and Development
course_description: The provide students the opportunities to propose policies that address current challenges in global health. The course utilizes a series of real-life examples, case-studies, invited speakers, and group discussions to provide students with tools to design a policy to address a problem in the area of maternal and child health, chronic or infectious diseases, environmental health, sexual or reproductive health, or public health nutrition in diverse settings. Students also will learn critical skills in leadership that will enable them to advocate for and/or implement global health policies.
